snippet: The state becomes the 23rd in the nation to bar union contracts from requiring non-union members to pay representation fees.
abstract: Indiana Gov Mitch Daniels signs 'right to work' legislation that bars union contracts from requiring non-union members to pay fees for labor representation; Indiana is the first state in over a decade to enact such legislation; thousands of union members and supporters march in protest of the bill.
lead_paragraph: The state becomes the 23rd in the nation to bar union contracts from requiring non-union members to pay representation fees.

headline.main: Indiana Governor Signs a Law Creating a ‘Right to Work’ State
headline.print_headline: Indiana Governor Signs a Law Creating a ‘Right to Work’ State
